         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:La_selecci%C3%B3n_turca_de_baloncesto_tras_recibir_la_medalla_de_plata.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Turkey_national_basketball_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Turkey national basketball team">Turkey</a> won the silver medal at the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIBA_World_Championship" title="2010 FIBA World Championship">2010 FIBA World Championship</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The most popular <a href="/wiki/Sports_in_Turkey" class="mw-redirect" title="Sports in Turkey">sport in Turkey</a> is <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-428" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-428">[426]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Galatasaray_S.K._(football)" title="Galatasaray S.K. (football)">Galatasaray</a> won the <a href="/wiki/2000_UEFA_Cup_Final" title="2000 UEFA Cup Final">UEFA Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/2000_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2000 UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a> in 2000.<sup id="cite_ref-uefa.com_429-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-uefa.com-429">[427]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Turkish_national_football_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Turkish national football team">Turkish national football team</a> has won the bronze medal at the <a href="/wiki/2002_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2002 FIFA World Cup">2002 FIFA World Cup</a>, the <a href="/wiki/2003_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2003 FIFA Confederations Cup">2003 FIFA Confederations Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008" title="UEFA Euro 2008">UEFA Euro 2008</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-tff.org1_430-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tff.org1-430">[428]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Other mainstream sports such as <a href="/wiki/Basketball" title="Basketball">basketball</a> and <a href="/wiki/Volleyball" title="Volleyball">volleyball</a> are also popular. The <a href="/wiki/Turkey_national_basketball_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Turkey national basketball team">men's national basketball team</a> won the silver medal at the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIBA_World_Championship" title="2010 FIBA World Championship">2010 FIBA World Championship</a> and at the <a href="/wiki/EuroBasket_2001" title="EuroBasket 2001">EuroBasket 2001</a>, which were both hosted by Turkey; and is one of the most successful at the <a href="/wiki/Basketball_at_the_Mediterranean_Games" title="Basketball at the Mediterranean Games">Mediterranean Games</a>. Turkish basketball club <a href="/wiki/Fenerbah%C3%A7e_Men%27s_Basketball" class="mw-redirect" title="Fenerbahçe Men's Basketball">Fenerbahçe</a> played the Final of the <a href="/wiki/EuroLeague" title="EuroLeague">EuroLeague</a> in three consecutive seasons (<a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_Euroleague" title="2015–16 Euroleague">2016</a>, <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_EuroLeague" title="2016–17 EuroLeague">2017</a> and <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_EuroLeague" title="2017–18 EuroLeague">2018</a>), becoming the European champions in 2017 and runners-up in 2016 and 2018. Another Turkish basketball club, <a href="/wiki/Anadolu_Efes_S.K." title="Anadolu Efes S.K.">Anadolu Efes S.K.</a> won the <a href="/wiki/1995%E2%80%9396_FIBA_Kora%C4%87_Cup" title="1995–96 FIBA Korać Cup">1995–96</a> <a href="/wiki/FIBA_Kora%C4%87_Cup" title="FIBA Korać Cup">FIBA Korać Cup</a>, were the runners-up of the <a href="/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_EuroLeague" title="2018–19 EuroLeague">2018–19 EuroLeague</a> and the <a href="/wiki/1992%E2%80%9393_FIBA_European_Cup" title="1992–93 FIBA European Cup">1992–93</a> <a href="/wiki/FIBA_Saporta_Cup" title="FIBA Saporta Cup">FIBA Saporta Cup</a>, and finished third at the <a href="/wiki/1999%E2%80%932000_FIBA_EuroLeague" title="1999–2000 FIBA EuroLeague">1999–2000 EuroLeague</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2000%E2%80%9301_FIBA_SuproLeague" title="2000–01 FIBA SuproLeague">2000–01 SuproLeague</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-431" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-431">[429]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-432" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-432">[430]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Be%C5%9Fikta%C5%9F_men%27s_basketball_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Beşiktaş men's basketball team">Beşiktaş</a> won the <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_FIBA_EuroChallenge" title="2011–12 FIBA EuroChallenge">2011–12</a> <a href="/wiki/EuroChallenge" class="mw-redirect" title="EuroChallenge">FIBA EuroChallenge</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-fibaeurope.com1_433-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fibaeurope.com1-433">[431]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Galatasaray_S.K._(men%27s_basketball)" title="Galatasaray S.K. (men's basketball)">Galatasaray</a> won the <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_Eurocup_Basketball" title="2015–16 Eurocup Basketball">2015–16 Eurocup</a>. The Final of the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_EuroLeague_Women" title="2013–14 EuroLeague Women">2013–14 EuroLeague Women</a> basketball championship was played between two Turkish teams, <a href="/wiki/Galatasaray_S.K._(women%27s_basketball)" title="Galatasaray S.K. (women's basketball)">Galatasaray</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fenerbah%C3%A7e_Women%27s_Basketball" title="Fenerbahçe Women's Basketball">Fenerbahçe</a>, and won by Galatasaray.<sup id="cite_ref-fibaeurope.com2_434-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fibaeurope.com2-434">[432]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Turkey_women%27s_national_basketball_team" title="Turkey women's national basketball team">women's national basketball team</a> won the silver medal at the <a href="/wiki/EuroBasket_Women_2011" title="EuroBasket Women 2011">EuroBasket Women 2011</a> and the bronze medal at the <a href="/wiki/EuroBasket_Women_2013" title="EuroBasket Women 2013">EuroBasket Women 2013</a>. Like the men's team, the women's basketball team is one of the most successful at the <a href="/wiki/Basketball_at_the_Mediterranean_Games" title="Basketball at the Mediterranean Games">Mediterranean Games</a>. </p> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:GPTurkey05_start.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/GPTurkey05_start.jpg/220px-GPTurkey05_start.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/GPTurkey05_start.jpg/330px-GPTurkey05_start.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/GPTurkey05_start.jpg/440px-GPTurkey05_start.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2288" data-file-height="1712"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:GPTurkey05_start.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Formula_One" title="Formula One">Formula One</a> <a href="/wiki/Auto_racing" title="Auto racing">auto racing</a> returned to the <a href="/wiki/Intercity_Istanbul_Park" class="mw-redirect" title="Intercity Istanbul Park">Istanbul Park</a> circuit with the 2020 <a href="/wiki/Turkish_Grand_Prix" title="Turkish Grand Prix">Turkish Grand Prix</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-435" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-435">[433]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Turkey_women%27s_national_volleyball_team" title="Turkey women's national volleyball team">women's national volleyball team</a> won the gold medal at the <a href="/wiki/2015_European_Games" title="2015 European Games">2015 European Games</a>, the silver medal at the <a href="/wiki/2003_Women%27s_European_Volleyball_Championship" title="2003 Women's European Volleyball Championship">2003 European Championship</a>, the bronze medal at the <a href="/wiki/2011_Women%27s_European_Volleyball_Championship" title="2011 Women's European Volleyball Championship">2011 European Championship</a>, and the bronze medal at the <a href="/wiki/2012_FIVB_World_Grand_Prix" class="mw-redirect" title="2012 FIVB World Grand Prix">2012 FIVB World Grand Prix</a>. They also won multiple medals over multiple decades at the <a href="/wiki/Volleyball_at_the_Mediterranean_Games" title="Volleyball at the Mediterranean Games">Mediterranean Games</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-tvf.org.tr_436-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tvf.org.tr-436">[434]</a></sup> Women's volleyball clubs, namely <a href="/wiki/Fenerbah%C3%A7e_Women%27s_Volleyball" title="Fenerbahçe Women's Volleyball">Fenerbahçe</a>, <a href="/wiki/Eczac%C4%B1ba%C5%9F%C4%B1_Istanbul" class="mw-redirect" title="Eczacıbaşı Istanbul">Eczacıbaşı</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vak%C4%B1fbank_Spor_Kul%C3%BCb%C3%BC" class="mw-redirect" title="Vakıfbank Spor Kulübü">Vakıfbank</a>, have won numerous European championship titles and medals. <a href="/wiki/Fenerbah%C3%A7e_Women%27s_Volleyball" title="Fenerbahçe Women's Volleyball">Fenerbahçe</a> won the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIVB_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" class="mw-redirect" title="2010 FIVB Women's Club World Championship">2010 FIVB Women's Club World Championship</a> and the <a href="/wiki/CEV_Women%27s_Champions_League" title="CEV Women's Champions League">2012 CEV Women's Champions League</a>. Representing <a href="/wiki/European_Volleyball_Confederation" title="European Volleyball Confederation">Europe</a> as the winner of the <a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_CEV_Women%27s_Champions_League" title="2012–13 CEV Women's Champions League">2012–13 CEV Women's Champions League</a>, Vakıfbank also became the world champion by winning the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="2013 FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">2013 FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship</a>. Recently Vakıfbank has won the <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship</a> in <a href="/wiki/2017_FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="2017 FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">2017</a> and <a href="/wiki/2018_FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="2018 FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">2018</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-fenerbahce.org.tr_437-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fenerbahce.org.tr-437">[435]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-eczacibasisporkulubu.org.tr_438-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-eczacibasisporkulubu.org.tr-438">[436]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-hurriyet.com.tr1_439-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hurriyet.com.tr1-439">[437]</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_CEV_Women%27s_Champions_League" title="2017–18 CEV Women's Champions League">2017–18 CEV Women's Champions League</a> for the fourth time in their history.<sup id="cite_ref-auto_440-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto-440">[438]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2e/Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg/220px-Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2e/Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg/330px-Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2e/Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg/440px-Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5472" data-file-height="3648"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Vakifbanksk2018cl.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Vak%C4%B1fBank_S.K." title="VakıfBank S.K.">VakıfBank S.K.</a> has won the <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship</a> in <a href="/wiki/2017_FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="2017 FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">2017</a> and <a href="/wiki/2018_FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_Club_World_Championship" title="2018 FIVB Volleyball Women's Club World Championship">2018</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-fenerbahce.org.tr_437-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fenerbahce.org.tr-437">[435]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-eczacibasisporkulubu.org.tr_438-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-eczacibasisporkulubu.org.tr-438">[436]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-hurriyet.com.tr1_439-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hurriyet.com.tr1-439">[437]</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_CEV_Women%27s_Champions_League" title="2017–18 CEV Women's Champions League">2017–18 CEV Women's Champions League</a> for the fourth time in their history.<sup id="cite_ref-auto_440-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto-440">[438]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The traditional national sport of Turkey has been <a href="/wiki/Oil_wrestling" title="Oil wrestling">yağlı güreş</a> (<i><a href="/wiki/Olive_oil" title="Olive oil">oil</a> <a href="/wiki/Wrestling" title="Wrestling">wrestling</a></i>) since Ottoman times.<sup id="cite_ref-441" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-441">[439]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Edirne_Province" title="Edirne Province">Edirne Province</a> has hosted the annual <a href="/wiki/K%C4%B1rkp%C4%B1nar" title="Kırkpınar">Kırkpınar</a> oil wrestling tournament since 1361, making it the oldest continuously held sporting competition in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-442" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-442">[440]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-443" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-443">[441]</a></sup> In the 19th and early 20th centuries, Ottoman Turkish oil wrestling champions such as <a href="/wiki/Yusuf_%C4%B0smail" title="Yusuf İsmail">Koca Yusuf</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nurullah_Hasan" title="Nurullah Hasan">Nurullah Hasan</a> and <a href="/wiki/K%C4%B1z%C4%B1lc%C4%B1kl%C4%B1_Mahmut" title="Kızılcıklı Mahmut">Kızılcıklı Mahmut</a> acquired international fame in Europe and North America by winning world heavyweight wrestling championship titles. International wrestling styles governed by <a href="/wiki/International_Federation_of_Associated_Wrestling_Styles" class="mw-redirect" title="International Federation of Associated Wrestling Styles">FILA</a> such as <a href="/wiki/Freestyle_wrestling" title="Freestyle wrestling">freestyle wrestling</a> and <a href="/wiki/Greco-Roman_wrestling" title="Greco-Roman wrestling">Greco-Roman wrestling</a> are also popular, with many European, World and Olympic championship titles won by Turkish wrestlers both individually and as a national team.<sup id="cite_ref-444" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-444">[442]</a></sup> Renowned Turkish freestyle and Greco-Roman wrestlers who won international competitions include <a href="/wiki/Ya%C5%9Far_Do%C4%9Fu" title="Yaşar Doğu">Yaşar Doğu</a>, <a href="/wiki/Celal_Atik" title="Celal Atik">Celal Atik</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mahmut_Atalay" title="Mahmut Atalay">Mahmut Atalay</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hamza_Yerlikaya" title="Hamza Yerlikaya">Hamza Yerlikaya</a>, <a href="/wiki/R%C4%B1za_Kayaalp" title="Rıza Kayaalp">Rıza Kayaalp</a> and <a href="/wiki/Taha_Akg%C3%BCl" title="Taha Akgül">Taha Akgül</a>. </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Media_and_cinema">Media and cinema</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Media_in_Turkey" class="mw-redirect" title="Media in Turkey">Media in Turkey</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cinema_of_Turkey" title="Cinema of Turkey">Cinema of Turkey</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:TRT_World_logosu.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/TRT_World_logosu.png/220px-TRT_World_logosu.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="31" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/TRT_World_logosu.png/330px-TRT_World_logosu.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/TRT_World_logosu.png/440px-TRT_World_logosu.png 2x" data-file-width="1920" data-file-height="271"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:TRT_World_logosu.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/TRT_World" title="TRT World">TRT World</a> is the international news platform of the <a href="/wiki/Turkish_Radio_and_Television_Corporation" title="Turkish Radio and Television Corporation">Turkish Radio and Television Corporation</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-445" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-445">[443]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Hundreds of television channels, thousands of local and national radio stations, several dozen newspapers, a productive and profitable <a href="/wiki/Cinema_of_Turkey" title="Cinema of Turkey">national cinema</a> and a rapid growth of <a href="/wiki/Broadband" title="Broadband">broadband</a> Internet use constitute a vibrant media industry in Turkey.<sup id="cite_ref-tesevmedya_446-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tesevmedya-446">[444]</a></sup> The majority of the TV audiences are shared among public broadcaster <a href="/wiki/Turkish_Radio_and_Television_Corporation" title="Turkish Radio and Television Corporation">TRT</a> and the network-style channels such as <a href="/wiki/Kanal_D" title="Kanal D">Kanal D</a>, <a href="/wiki/Show_TV" title="Show TV">Show TV</a>, <a href="/wiki/ATV_(Turkey)" class="mw-redirect" title="ATV (Turkey)">ATV</a> and <a href="/wiki/Star_TV_(Turkey)" class="mw-redirect" title="Star TV (Turkey)">Star TV</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Broadcast_media" class="mw-redirect" title="Broadcast media">broadcast media</a> have a very high penetration as <a href="/wiki/Satellite_dishes" class="mw-redirect" title="Satellite dishes">satellite dishes</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cable_television" title="Cable television">cable</a> systems are widely available.<sup id="cite_ref-cp_447-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cp-447">[445]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/RT%C3%9CK" class="mw-redirect" title="RTÜK">Radio and Television Supreme Council (RTÜK)</a> is the government body overseeing the broadcast media.<sup id="cite_ref-cp_447-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cp-447">[445]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-448" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-448">[446]</a></sup> By circulation, the <a href="/wiki/List_of_newspapers_in_Turkey" title="List of newspapers in Turkey">most popular newspapers</a> are <i><a href="/wiki/Posta_(newspaper)" title="Posta (newspaper)">Posta</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/H%C3%BCrriyet" title="Hürriyet">Hürriyet</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/S%C3%B6zc%C3%BC" title="Sözcü">Sözcü</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Sabah_(newspaper)" title="Sabah (newspaper)">Sabah</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Habert%C3%BCrk" title="Habertürk">Habertürk</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-449" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-449">[447]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Turkish_television_drama" title="Turkish television drama">Turkish television dramas</a> are increasingly becoming popular beyond Turkey's borders and are among the country's most vital exports, both in terms of profit and public relations.<sup id="cite_ref-450" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-450">[448]</a></sup> After sweeping the <a href="/wiki/Middle_East" title="Middle East">Middle East</a>'s television market over the past decade, Turkish shows have aired in more than a dozen <a href="/wiki/South_America" title="South America">South</a> and <a href="/wiki/Central_America" title="Central America">Central American</a> countries in 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-451" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-451">[449]</a></sup> Turkey is today the world's second largest exporter of television series.<sup id="cite_ref-452" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-452">[450]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg/220px-Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg/330px-Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg/440px-Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4256" data-file-height="2832"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Aspendos_Amphitheatre.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The closing ceremony of the annual <a href="/wiki/International_Antalya_Golden_Orange_Film_Festival" class="mw-redirect" title="International Antalya Golden Orange Film Festival">International Antalya Golden Orange Film Festival</a> takes place at the <a href="/wiki/Aspendos" title="Aspendos">Aspendos</a> <a href="/wiki/Amphitheatre" title="Amphitheatre">amphitheatre</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p><i><a href="/wiki/Ye%C5%9Fil%C3%A7am" class="mw-redirect" title="Yeşilçam">Yeşilçam</a></i> is the <a href="/wiki/Sobriquet" title="Sobriquet">sobriquet</a> that refers to the Turkish film art and industry. The first movie exhibited in the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> was the <a href="/wiki/Lumiere_Brothers" class="mw-redirect" title="Lumiere Brothers">Lumiere Brothers</a>' 1895 film, <i><a href="/wiki/L%27Arriv%C3%A9e_d%27un_train_en_gare_de_La_Ciotat" title="L'Arrivée d'un train en gare de La Ciotat">L'Arrivée d'un train en gare de La Ciotat</a></i>, which was shown in <a href="/wiki/Istanbul" title="Istanbul">Istanbul</a> in 1896. The first Turkish-made film was a documentary entitled <i><a href="/wiki/Ayastefanos%27taki_Rus_Abidesinin_Y%C4%B1k%C4%B1l%C4%B1%C5%9F%C4%B1" title="Ayastefanos'taki Rus Abidesinin Yıkılışı">Ayastefanos'taki Rus Abidesinin Yıkılışı</a></i> (<i>Demolition of the Russian Monument at <a href="/wiki/Ye%C5%9Filk%C3%B6y" title="Yeşilköy">San Stefano</a></i>), directed by <a href="/wiki/Fuat_Uzk%C4%B1nay" title="Fuat Uzkınay">Fuat Uzkınay</a> and completed in 1914. The first narrative film, <a href="/wiki/Sedat_Simavi" title="Sedat Simavi">Sedat Simavi</a>'s <i>The Spy</i>, was released in 1917. Turkey's first sound film was shown in 1931. Turkish directors like <a href="/wiki/Nuri_Bilge_Ceylan" title="Nuri Bilge Ceylan">Nuri Bilge Ceylan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Y%C4%B1lmaz_G%C3%BCney" title="Yılmaz Güney">Yılmaz Güney</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ferzan_%C3%96zpetek" title="Ferzan Özpetek">Ferzan Özpetek</a> won numerous international awards such as the <a href="/wiki/Palme_d%27Or" title="Palme d'Or">Palme d'Or</a> and <a href="/wiki/Golden_Bear" title="Golden Bear">Golden Bear</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-turkishculture.org5_453-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-turkishculture.org5-453">[451]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Despite legal provisions, <a href="/wiki/Media_freedom_in_Turkey" class="mw-redirect" title="Media freedom in Turkey">media freedom in Turkey</a> has steadily deteriorated from 2010 onwards, with a precipitous decline following the failed <a href="/wiki/2016_Turkish_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat_attempt" title="2016 Turkish coup d'état attempt">coup attempt</a> on 15 July 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-454" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-454">[452]</a></sup> As of December 2016, at least 81 <a href="/wiki/List_of_arrested_journalists_in_Turkey" title="List of arrested journalists in Turkey">journalists were imprisoned</a> in Turkey and more than 100 news outlets were closed.<sup id="cite_ref-cpj.org1_233-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cpj.org1-233">[231]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Freedom_House" title="Freedom House">Freedom House</a> lists Turkey's <a href="/wiki/Media_freedom_in_Turkey" class="mw-redirect" title="Media freedom in Turkey">media</a> as <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_the_Press_(report)" title="Freedom of the Press (report)"><i>not free</i></a>.<sup id="cite_ref-freedomhouse_235-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-freedomhouse-235">[233]</a></sup> The media crackdowns also extend to <a href="/wiki/Internet_censorship" title="Internet censorship">Internet censorship</a> with <a href="/wiki/2017_block_of_Wikipedia_in_Turkey" class="mw-redirect" title="2017 block of Wikipedia in Turkey">Wikipedia getting blocked</a> between 29 April 2017 and 15 January 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-455" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-455">[453]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-456" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-456">[454]</a></sup> </p>

      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style>
      <div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha"> 
       <div class="mw-references-wrap">
        <ol class="references"> 
         <li id="cite_note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-11">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Turkish: <i lang="tr">Türkiye Cumhuriyeti</i> <small></small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Turkish" title="Help:IPA/Turkish">[ˈtyɾcije dʒumˈhuːɾijeti]</a></span> <span class="nowrap" style="font-size:85%">(<span class="unicode haudio"><span class="fn"><span style="white-space:nowrap;margin-right:.25em;"><a href="/wiki/File:Tur-T%C3%BCrkiye_Cumhuriyeti.ogg" title="About this sound"><img alt="About this sound" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" decoding="async" width="11" height="11" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="20" data-file-height="20"></a></span><a href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/37/Tur-T%C3%BCrkiye_Cumhuriyeti.ogg" class="internal" title="Tur-Türkiye Cumhuriyeti.ogg">listen</a></span></span>)</span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-two-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-two_23-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has said "Our attitude on the Armenian issue has been clear from the beginning. We will never accept the accusations of genocide".<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">[20]</a></sup> Scholars give several reasons for Turkey's <a href="/wiki/Armenian_Genocide_denial#Causes" class="mw-redirect" title="Armenian Genocide denial">position</a> including the preservation of national identity, the demand for reparations and territorial concerns.<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">[21]</a></sup></span> </li> 
        </ol>
       </div>

         <li id="cite_note-IMF-WEO-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-IMF-WEO_8-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMF-WEO_8-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMF-WEO_8-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMF-WEO_8-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IMF-WEO_8-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-SchallerZimmerer-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-SchallerZimmerer_24-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFSchallerZimmerer2008" class="citation journal cs1">Schaller, Dominik J.; Zimmerer, Jürgen (2008). "Late Ottoman genocides: the dissolution of the Ottoman Empire and Young Turkish population and extermination policies—introduction". <i>Journal of Genocide Research</i>. <b>10</b> (1): 7–14. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F14623520801950820">10.1080/14623520801950820</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/1462-3528">1462-3528</a>. <a href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:71515470">71515470</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Genocide+Research&amp;rft.atitle=Late+Ottoman+genocides%3A+the+dissolution+of+the+Ottoman+Empire+and+Young+Turkish+population+and+extermination+policies%E2%80%94introduction&amp;rft.volume=10&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=7-14&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A71515470%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.issn=1462-3528&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F14623520801950820&amp;rft.aulast=Schaller&amp;rft.aufirst=Dominik+J.&amp;rft.au=Zimmerer%2C+J%C3%BCrgen&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-41">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aina.org/articles/assyrianidentity.pdf">"Assyrian Identity in Ancient Times And Today<span class="cs1-kern-right">'</span>"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span><span class="reference-accessdate">.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFWink1990" class="citation book cs1">Wink, Andre (1990). <i>Al Hind: The Making of the Indo Islamic World, Vol. 1, Early Medieval India and the Expansion of Islam, 7th–11th Centuries</i>.          <li id="cite_note-80"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-80">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-BoweringCrone2012-95"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-BoweringCrone2012_95-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFGerhard_BoweringPatricia_CroneWadad_KadiDevin_J._Stewart2012" class="citation book cs1">Gerhard Bowering; Patricia Crone; Wadad Kadi; Devin J. Stewart; Muhammad Qasim Zaman; Mahan Mirza (2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=JHcZlo12SGoC&amp;pg=PA49"><i>The Princeton Encyclopedia of Islamic Political Thought</i></a>. Princeton University Press. p.&nbsp;49. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4008-3855-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4008-3855-4"><bdi>978-1-4008-3855-4</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">14 August</span> 2013</span>. <q>Following the revolution, Mustafa Kemal became an important figure in the military ranks of the Ottoman Committee of Union and Progress (CUP) as a protégé&nbsp;... Although the sultanate had already been abolished in November 1922, the republic was founded in October 1923.&nbsp;... ambitious reform programme aimed at the creation of a modern, secular state and the construction of a new identity for its citizens.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Princeton+Encyclopedia+of+Islamic+Political+Thought&amp;rft.pages=49&amp;rft.pub=Princeton+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4008-3855-4&amp;rft.au=Gerhard+Bowering&amp;rft.au=Patricia+Crone&amp;rft.au=Wadad+Kadi&amp;rft.au=Devin+J.+Stewart&amp;rft.au=Muhammad+Qasim+Zaman&amp;rft.au=Mahan+Mirza&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DJHcZlo12SGoC%26pg%3DPA49&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-96"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-96">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><i>League of Nations Treaty Series</i>, vol. 173, pp. 214–241.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-97"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-97">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHassan2017" class="citation book cs1">Hassan, Mona (10 January 2017). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=pqqtDAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA168"><i>Longing for the Lost Caliphate: A Transregional History</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-TR_EUChrono-115"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-TR_EUChrono_115-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-TR_EUChrono_115-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-TR_EUChrono_115-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-165"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-165">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFElanchenny2010" class="citation book cs1">Elanchenny, Susae (2010). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=9chOD205h2YC"><i>Breaking the Ice The Role of Civil Society and Media in Turkey-Armenia Relations An Evaluation of the 'Dialogue-Building between Turkey and Armenia' Project</i></a>. In Lust, Ellen (ed.). <i>The Middle East</i> (14&nbsp;ed.). CQ Press. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-5063-2930-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-5063-2930-7"><bdi>978-1-5063-2930-7</bdi></a>. <q>The Turkish military responded with a ferocious counterinsurgency campaign that led to the deaths of nearly 40,000 people, most of them Turkish Kurdish civilians, and the displacement of more than three million Kurds from southeastern Turkey.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Turkey&amp;rft.btitle=The+Middle+East&amp;rft.edition=14&amp;rft.pub=CQ+Press&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-5063-2930-7&amp;rft.aulast=Eder&amp;rft.aufirst=Mine&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DQ_nlCgAAQBAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-hum1-218"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-hum1_218-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation journal cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://hudoc.echr.coe.int/app/conversion/pdf/?library=ECHR&amp;id=001-128036&amp;filename=001-128036.pdf">"The European Court of Human Rights: Case of Benzer and others v. Turkey"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (Procedure). 24 March 2014: 3.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=The+European+Court+of+Human+Rights%3A+Case+of+Benzer+and+others+v.+Turkey&amp;rft.issue=Procedure&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.date=2014-03-24&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fhudoc.echr.coe.int%2Fapp%2Fconversion%2Fpdf%2F%3Flibrary%3DECHR%26id%3D001-128036%26filename%3D001-128036.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span> <span class="cs1-hidden-error error citation-comment">Cite journal requires <code class="cs1-code">|journal=</code> (<a href="/wiki/Help:CS1_errors#missing_periodical" title="Help:CS1 errors">help</a>)</span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-253"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-253">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.britannica.com/place/Armenian-Highland">"Armenian Highland – Historic Region"</a>. <i>Encyclopedia Britannica</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 November</span> 2018</span>. <q>Armenian Highland, mountainous region of western Asia. It lies mainly in Turkey, occupies all of Armenia, and includes southern Georgia, western Azerbaijan, and northwestern Iran.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Armenian+Highland+%E2%80%93+Historic+Region&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopedia+Britannica&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.britannica.com%2Fplace%2FArmenian-Highland&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-309"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-309">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.shura.org.tr/energy_pricing_and_non-market_flows_in_turkeys_energy_sector-2/">"Energy pricing and non-market flows in Turkey's energy sector • SHURA Enerji Dönüşümü Merkezi"</a>. <i>SHURA Enerji Dönüşümü Merkezi</i><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-mutlu-324"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-mutlu_324-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-mutlu_324-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMutlu1996" class="citation journal cs1">Mutlu, Servet (1996).          <li id="cite_note-Turkey_Ethnic_groups-325"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Turkey_Ethnic_groups_325-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFExtraGorter,_Durk2001" class="citation book cs1">Extra, Guus; Gorter, Durk (2001). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=hvmy_skUPNYC&amp;pg=PARA1-PA422"><i>The other languages of Europe: Demographic, Sociolinguistic and Educational Perspectives</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-392"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-392">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFRoyal_Academy_of_Arts2005" class="citation web cs1"><a href="/wiki/Royal_Academy_of_Arts" title="Royal Academy of Arts">Royal Academy of Arts</a> (2005). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070218095819/http://www.turks.org.uk/index.php?pid=8">"Turks – A Journey of a Thousand Years: 600–1600"</a>. Royal Academy of Arts. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.turks.org.uk/index.php?pid=8">the original</a> on 18 February 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 December</span> 2006</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Turks+%E2%80%93+A+Journey+of+a+Thousand+Years%3A+600%E2%80%931600&amp;rft.pub=Royal+Academy+of+Arts&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.au=Royal+Academy+of+Arts&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.turks.org.uk%2Findex.php%3Fpid%3D8&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-HarriOhta1999-393"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-HarriOhta1999_393-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAntoinette_HarriAllison_Ohta1999" class="citation book cs1">Antoinette Harri; Allison Ohta (1999). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=1CxNAAAAYAAJ"><i>10th International Congress of Turkish Art</i></a>. Fondation Max Van Berchem. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-2-05-101763-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-2-05-101763-3"><bdi>978-2-05-101763-3</bdi></a>. <q>The first military training institutions were the Imperial Army Engineering School (Mühendishane-i Berr-i Hümâyun, 1793) and the Imperial School of Military Sciences (Mekteb-i Ulûm-ı Harbiye-i Şahane, 1834). Both schools taught painting to enable cadets to produce topographic layouts and technical drawings to illustrate landscapes&nbsp;...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=10th+International+Congress+of+Turkish+Art&amp;rft.pub=Fondation+Max+Van+Berchem&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-2-05-101763-3&amp;rft.au=Antoinette+Harri&amp;rft.au=Allison+Ohta&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D1CxNAAAAYAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-turkresmi.com-394"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-turkresmi.com_394-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20060908221749/http://www.turkresmi.com/klasorler/10lar_yenidal_siyahkalem/index.htm">"<span class="cs1-kern-left">"</span>10'Lar' Grubu", "Yenı Dal Grubu", "Sıyah Kalem Grubu<span class="cs1-kern-right">"</span>"</a>. <i>turkresmi.com</i>.          <li id="cite_note-.ncturkishfestival.-409"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-.ncturkishfestival._409-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090312043050/http://www.ncturkishfestival.com/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=category&amp;layout=blog&amp;id=19&amp;Itemid=114">"Turkish Folk Dances"</a>. <i>ncturkishfestival</i>.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.trtworld.com">"TRT World"</a>. <i>www.trtworld.com</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=www.trtworld.com&amp;rft.atitle=TRT+World&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.trtworld.com&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATurkey" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-tesevmedya-446"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-tesevmedya_446-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2>

                 <li><b>Individual, family and gender relations</b>

                  </ul></li>

                    <ul>
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Turkish_people" title="Turkish people">Anatolian Turks</a> (<a href="/wiki/Abdal_of_Turkey" title="Abdal of Turkey">Abdal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tahtac%C4%B1" title="Tahtacı">Tahtacı</a>, <a href="/wiki/Y%C3%B6r%C3%BCks" title="Yörüks">Yörüks</a>)</li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Azerbaijanis_in_Turkey" title="Azerbaijanis in Turkey">Azerbaijanis</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Crimean_Tatars_in_Turkey" title="Crimean Tatars in Turkey">Crimean Tatars</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Karachays" title="Karachays">Karachays</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Kazakhs" title="Kazakhs">Kazakhs</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Kyrgyz_people" title="Kyrgyz people">Kyrgyz</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Meskhetian_Turks" title="Meskhetian Turks">Meskhetian Turks</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Nogais" title="Nogais">Nogais</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Turkmens" title="Turkmens">Turkmens</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Uyghurs" title="Uyghurs">Uyghurs</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Uzbeks" title="Uzbeks">Uzbeks</a></li>
                    </ul></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Zazas" title="Zazas">Zazas</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
              </tbody>
             </table>
            </div>

                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
                 <div>
                  <div class="plainlist">
                   <ul>
                    <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
                    <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
                   </ul>

                 <div style="display:inline-block; padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">
                  <a href="/wiki/Dependent_territory" title="Dependent territory">Dependencies</a> 
                  <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886047488">.mw-parser-output .nobold{font-weight:normal}</style><span class="nobold">and</span> <a href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of China">special<br>administrative regions</a>
                 </div></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"></div>

               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">History</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD#Founding" title="OECD">Convention on the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD_Anti-Bribery_Convention" title="OECD Anti-Bribery Convention">OECD Anti-Bribery Convention</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Guidelines</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD_Guidelines_for_Multinational_Enterprises" title="OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises">Multinational Enterprises</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD_Guidelines_for_the_Testing_of_Chemicals" title="OECD Guidelines for the Testing of Chemicals">Testing of Chemicals</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
              </tbody>
             </table>
            </div>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">People</th>

                   <li><a href="/wiki/European_Court_of_Human_Rights" title="European Court of Human Rights">Court of Human Rights</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Commissioner_for_Human_Rights" title="Commissioner for Human Rights">Commissioner for Human Rights</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/European_Commission_for_the_Efficiency_of_Justice" title="European Commission for the Efficiency of Justice">Commission for the Efficiency of Justice</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/European_Commission_against_Racism_and_Intolerance" title="European Commission against Racism and Intolerance">Commission against Racism and Intolerance</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Venice_Commission" title="Venice Commission">Venice Commission</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="4" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">
                 <div>
                  <a href="/wiki/File:Council_of_Europe.svg" class="image"><img alt="Council of Europe.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/Council_of_Europe.svg/120px-Council_of_Europe.svg.png" decoding="async" width="120" height="101" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/Council_of_Europe.svg/180px-Council_of_Europe.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/Council_of_Europe.svg/240px-Council_of_Europe.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="2045" data-file-height="1720"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Observers</th>

    <nav id="p-lang" class="mw-portlet mw-portlet-lang vector-menu vector-menu-portal portal" aria-labelledby="p-lang-label" role="navigation"> 
     <h3 id="p-lang-label" class="vector-menu-heading"> <span>Languages</span> </h3> 
     <div class="vector-menu-content"> 
      <ul class="vector-menu-content-list">
       <li class="interlanguage-link interwiki-ace"><a href="https://ace.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turuki" title="Turuki – Achinese" lang="ace" hreflang="ace" class="interlanguage-link-target">Acèh</a></li>
       <li class="interlanguage-link interwiki-kbd"><a href="https://kbd.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A2%D1%8B%D1%80%D0%BA%D1%83%D0%B5%D0%B9" title="Тыркуей – Kabardian" lang="kbd" hreflang="kbd" class="interlanguage-link-target">Адыгэбзэ</a></li>
